posts.content:
beetleben wrote:I agree with the last couple of posts, I sold my last 15w for a fairly high price I thought and then the guy was gonna spend another 25% of the value converting it to RHD an shipping it to New Zealand. I in turn paid a fairly high price tag for my latest bus. They're worth what someone is willing to pay, but as said previously there are buses that have been for sale for 12 months and haven't dropped their asking price which seems rediculous considering they're asking £60k+


Your bus was the one I let get away thinking about it, if something like it comes up again ill just go for it! Like I normally do.

author.location: Sunny Jersey in the Channel Islands

posts.content:
My favourite phrase used to sell something is "rare"', which is then usually accompanied by a large price tag to boot.

Rare does not necessarily mean desirable. If you have a VW that is desirable then like everything else in this world you can expect to pay a premium. What I detest seeing is something that has the generic "rare" term used and an extra £5-10k on the price ticket.

All our vans are rare, just some more so than others and some more desirable than others.

Dr. G

johnny k wrote:Nothing because they already own it.

johnny k wrote:I no longer have a bus.

Don't go there, Rolf tried it, Cliff's tried it, it's not worth the hassle in the long run.

On another note, bus prices....with sh1t ads, c'mon, you want top money for your bus, but your advert is crap.

A brief description, no photo's, and a link to another forum.

I say if its not properly listed with a price, decent description and a few photo's (maybe a link to photobucket or something similar also is acceptable as well as photo's) then the mods should warn, freeze then delete the post.

Tops price wanted for bus but not top advert.

Glad I didn't let it go a few months ago for £12.

Might put it up for £40 and see if it goes. Might sell those books for a few hundre each too, cos dey is scene, man.
